availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Strother Boyd (Harrison County, Kentucky, attorney and judge)

body.p: Harrison County, Kentucky, attorney and judge. Attended Center College in Danville, Kentucky. Graduated from Transylvania University's school of law in Lexington, Kentucky, in 1844. Attorney in Harrison County in 1850. Elected to the Harrison Circuit Court in 1856. clerk of the Harrison County Circuit Court in 1860. He served as a Judge in the Harrison Circuit Court until 1862. Died in Cynthiana on August 5, 1888.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 1, p. 59A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, Cynthiana, p. 584.
"Judge Boyd Dead," Harrison County Courier (Cynthiana, Kentucky), August 11, 1888, p. 3 (accessed via http://usgenwebsites.org/KYHarrison/HarrisonCourier1888-89.htm).
